refnamediv.refpurpose: A reverberator consisting of 6 parallel comb-lowpass filters.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is a reverberator consisting of 6 parallel comb-lowpass filters being fed into a series of 5 allpass filters. nreverb replaces reverb2 (version 3.48) and so both opcodes are identical.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares nreverb asig, ktime, khdif [, iskip] [,inumCombs] [, ifnCombs] \ [, inumAlpas] [, ifnAlpas]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: iskip (optional, default=0) -- Skip initialization if present and non-zero.
inumCombs (optional) -- number of filter constants in comb filter. If omitted, the values default to the nreverb constants. New in Csound version 4.09.

ifnCombs - function table with inumCombs comb filter time values, followed the same number of gain values. The ftable should not be rescaled (use negative fgen number). Positive time values are in seconds. The time values are converted internally into number of samples, then set to the next greater prime number. If the time is negative, it is interpreted directly as time in sample frames, and no processing is done (except negation). New in Csound version 4.09.
inumAlpas, ifnAlpas (optional) -- same as inumCombs/ifnCombs, for allpass filter. New in Csound 4.09.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: The input signal asig is reverberated for ktime seconds. The parameter khdif controls the high frequency diffusion amount. The values of khdif should be from 0 to 1. If khdif is set to 0 the all the frequencies decay with the same speed. If khdif is 1, high frequencies decay faster than lower ones. If ktime is inadvertently set to a non-positive number, ktime will be reset automatically to 0.01. (New in Csound version 4.07.)
As of Csound version 4.09, nreverb may read any number of comb and allpass filter from an ftable.
